intro: Gaulettia amaraliae, commonly known as the Florida aster, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, purple to pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, seed-like fruits called achene. Gaulettia amaraliae plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is considered a valuable component of wetland ecosystems.
